stem: How can hi‑lo (internal misalignment) be minimized during fit‑up?

choices.text: Use clamps, hi‑lo tools, and alignment fixtures
Hammer it flush after the weld cools
Rely on weld metal to fill the offset

rationales.CHOICE-2: Proper clamping and alignment tools set parts flush before welding.

stem: How can internal misalignment (hi-lo) be minimized during fit-up?

choices.text: Use clamps, hi-lo tools, and alignment fixtures
Fill the offset with weld metal

rationales.CHOICE-2: Clamps and alignment tools set parts flush before welding.

stem: What is the purpose of a backing bar or strip?

choices.text: It supports the root pass and helps prevent burn‑through
It is forbidden by all codes

rationales.CHOICE-1: Backing provides support and can aid complete joint penetration.

stem: Why choose a proper bevel angle during prep?

choices.text: The right angle allows access and proper penetration

rationales.CHOICE-2: Adequate groove angle lets the electrode/torch reach the root and sidewalls.

stem: What are bridge tacks used for?

choices.text: They are forbidden for any process

rationales.CHOICE-1: Bridge tacks hold edges where gaps exist until proper welding occurs.

rationales.CHOICE-1: Bridge tacks hold edges where small gaps exist until welding.

stem: How do chill bars help when welding thin material?

choices.text: They extract heat to control distortion

rationales.CHOICE-2: Heat sinks pull heat away to limit distortion and burn‑through.

stem: To make a clean tie-in when restarting, you should:

choices.text: Feather the stop and restart slightly ahead, then backfill
Strike on the finished face without grinding

rationales.CHOICE-2: Feathering and tie-in ahead blends beads without defects.

stem: To make a clean tie-in when restarting, you should:

choices.text: Feather the stop and restart slightly ahead, then backfill
Strike on the finished face without grinding

rationales.CHOICE-2: Feathering and tie-in ahead blends beads without defects.

stem: How should distortion be addressed during fabrication planning?

choices.text: Plan fit and sequence to allow for predicted shrinkage
Clamps cause distortion and should be avoided
Heat input is unrelated to distortion

rationales.CHOICE-2: Anticipating shrinkage lets you set counter‑measures like sequencing and fixturing.

stem: Why remove burrs and oxides from prepared edges?

choices.text: It saves time but reduces strength
It is unnecessary on any material
It improves fusion and reduces inclusions

rationales.CHOICE-3: Clean, smooth edges promote full fusion and fewer inclusions.

choices.text: Reduces cooling rate and hydrogen cracking risk

stem: A small root face (land) on groove edges helps to:

choices.text: Control root penetration and support the root

rationales.CHOICE-2: A land supports root control and bead shape.

stem: Why is a consistent root opening important before welding a butt joint?

choices.text: It has no effect on penetration
It helps control penetration and root fusion
A completely closed gap is always best
A very large gap prevents burn-through

rationales.CHOICE-2: Uniform gaps help achieve consistent root fusion without burn-through.

stem: Why install run-on/run-off tabs?

choices.text: To start/stop off the part and protect edges

rationales.CHOICE-2: Tabs enable full fusion at tie-ins without damaging part edges.

stem: Why use skip or backstep welding sequences?

choices.text: To concentrate heat in one area
To distribute heat and reduce distortion
To always weld straight through in one pass

rationales.CHOICE-2: Sequencing spreads heat input and limits distortion.

stem: What is the function of strongbacks during fabrication?

choices.text: They prevent distortion and hold alignment while welding

rationales.CHOICE-2: Strongbacks restrain parts to counteract weld shrinkage.

choices.text: Sized so they can be fused into the final weld

rationales.CHOICE-2: Properly sized tacks fuse into the weld without defects.

stem: What is a good way to tack welds be sized?

choices.text: Very large tacks are always best
Sized to fuse into the final weld without defects
Always tiny tacks regardless of gap

rationales.CHOICE-2: Proper tacks fuse smoothly into the weld.
